column5: Thanks, thats it. Looks like he dumped the forums section.
Thanks for the great read! I think you have your head/heart in the right spot. If you don't make it fun why even go? Later, Jay
Thanks all - glad everyone enjoyed it Its a long winter for some and time between trips is about as slow as Christmas Eve to Christmas morning for a 6 year old lol Andrew

It’s been a while since my last post. Life has been busy but sitting squarely in the shoulder season I finally go around to oneEach trip I take I try to get up early, have a coffee and jot down notes about the previous day. Some of its useless ramblings (a lot of it) but on our recent trip I managed to capture a few key insights I thought I would share https://www.northernjacks.com/post/5...on-miniss-lakeCheersAndrew

Thanks Andrew another fine read, we gave up and fish counts and anything that could cause stress or pressure along time ago and now use the trip as a holiday to relax and the fish are a bonus. Pre trip work sure helps narrow down some possi le hot spots and always a starting point and jigs are it that's all you need in the north to put fillets in the pan.
Nice report, liked the sharing of just enjoying being there and the surroundings! Bill
Thanks Mike and Bill. Glad you enjoyed. It’s taken me quite a few trips but trying to soak it all in is important I think. The week goes fast and it’s easy to race through it and miss outAndrew

Nice read Andrew. The thing that resonates for me is "enjoying the moment." A week in the Canadian wilderness is special and if we never caught a fish, it would still be worth the effort. Like I say to people that ask me about our Canadian fishing adventures, "There is a lot more to Canadian fishing than the fish!" Keep it coming! Fish On! Hooks
Nice. It reminds me I need to work on my jigging technique. I can identify with "Breathe in the Air" - better than meds!
Does Borger still have his web site? I haven't checked in a while and now can't remember what it was.
One of the best lakes we've fished. We fished it for many years. Left me with some of the best memories of fishing and comradery I ever had.
Great read once again, we use much of the same strategy on our trip. stay safe
https://www.canadafishingguide.net I think is what it was/is. Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
